required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 24 Hour Plasma Glucose Profiles Comparing Lispro Mix 75/25 vs. Glargine
clinical_study.official_title: Twenty-Four-Hour Plasma Glucose Profiles Observed in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes During Therapy Consisting of Oral Agent(s) Plus Twice-Daily Insulin Lispro Low Mixture or Once-Daily Insulin Glargine

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if twice-daily Lispro low mixture (75/25) will result in lower post prandial blood glucose readings versus once-daily glargine plus oral diabetic medications.

detailed_description.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to test the hypothesis that a twice daily insulin regimen consisting of insulin lispro (mix 75/25)plus OAMs will result in a lower 2 hour postprandial plasma glucose, averaged across the morning and evening meals, compared with once daily insulin glargine plus OAMs at bedtime following 12 weeks of treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Combined morning and evening mean 2 hour postprandial plasma glucose during each 24 hour inpatient period.
primary_outcome.time_frame: At end of treatment arm or 3 months.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At end of treatment arm or 3 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: 2 hour plasma glucose excursions, plasma glucose AUC, and plasma glucose AUC excursions after the three main test meals combined
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At end of treatment arm or 3 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma glucose AUC excursions during a 24 hours when plasma glucose exceeds the following: greater than or equal to 7.5 mmol/L (135 mg/dL), greater than or equal to 7.8 mmol/L (140 mg/dL), and greater than or equal to 10.0 mmol/L (180 mg/dL)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At end of treatment arm or 3 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: The number of patients with increased plasma glucose during the last 2 hours of each inpatient period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At end of treatment arm or 3 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: The mean amplitude of glycemic excursion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At end of treatment arm or 3 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentration of plasma triglycerides and free fatty acids
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At end of treatment arm or 3 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Self blood glucose monitoring parameters: fasting, premeal, 2 hour postprandial, 2 hour postprandial excursion, bedtime, and overall daily blood glucose value
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At end of treatment arm or 3 months.
At end of treatment arm or 3 months.

arm_group.description: Lispro mixture 75/25 twice-daily, SC injection, given in conjunction with oral antidiabetic medications.
Glargine, once-daily, SC injection, given in conjunction with oral antidiabetic medications.

intervention.description: Lispro mix 75/25 twice-daily, SC injection, given in conjunction with oral antidiabetic medications.
SC injection, once-daily, given in conjunction with oral antidiabetic medications.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have type 2 diabetes
- Have inadequate overall glycemic control (hemoglobin A1c greater than or equal to 7.0% and less than or equal to 12.0%) at or within 4 weeks prior to Visit 1
- Have used:
- single or multiple OAMs for at least 3 months immediately prior to entering the study, including metformin, sulfonylurea, meglitinides (repaglinide, nateglinide), or alpha glucosidase inhibitors (acarbose, miglitol); or
- insulin (once or twice daily) for at least 3 months immediately prior to entering the study; or
- a combination of the above.
- Are greater than or equal to 21 and less than 80 years of age
- As determined by the investigator, are capable and willing to:
- comply with their prescribed diet and medication regimen,
- perform self blood glucose monitoring,
- use the patient diary as required for this protocol,
- participate in two 24 hour inpatient assessments
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have used a thiazolidinedione (pioglitazone or rosiglitazone) during the 3 months prior to entry into the study
- Are currently treated with a meglitinide without sulfonylurea
- Have a known allergy or intolerance to insulin lispro mix 75/25, insulin glargine, or metformin
- Have plasma creatinine greater than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL (for males) or greater than or equal to 1.4 mg/dL (for females) for patients who will be treated with metformin or; greater than 2 mg/dL for patients treated with other OAMs, as determined by a local laboratory
- Have received chronic (lasting longer than 2 weeks), systemic glucocorticoid therapy (excluding topical and inhaled preparations) within 4 weeks immediately prior to Visit 1

overall_official.last_name: Call 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559) or 1-317-615-4559 Mon-Fri 9 AM - 5 PM Eastern time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST)

results_reference.citation: Roach P, Malone JK. Comparison of insulin lispro mixture 25/75 with insulin glargine during a 24-h standardized test-meal period in patients with Type 2 diabetes. Diabet Med. 2006 Jul;23(7):743-9.
